skill.name: when-verifying-quality-use-verification-quality
skill.description: Comprehensive quality verification and validation through static analysis, dynamic testing, integration validation, and certification gates
skill.summary: Automated 5-phase quality verification with static analysis, dynamic testing, integration validation, and production certification gates
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: Skill contains documentation for quality verification processes. Static scanner flagged compliance terms (SOC2, GDPR, WCAG) as C2 keywords, SHA-256 crypto operations as weak algorithms, and command references in documentation as external commands. All findings are false positives from documentation-only content. No actual malicious code execution patterns detected.

high_findings.title: C2 Keywords Detected
high_findings.description: Scanner detected C2 keywords (SOC2, GDPR, WCAG) flagged as Command and Control terms. These are legitimate compliance frameworks, not malware C2 infrastructure.
high_findings.reasoning: SOC2, GDPR, WCAG are compliance and accessibility standards documented in the skill. No actual C2 infrastructure or malicious command-and-control behavior present.

high_findings.title: Weak Cryptographic Algorithm
high_findings.description: Scanner flagged SHA-256 usage as weak cryptographic algorithm. SHA-256 is a secure, industry-standard hash algorithm.
high_findings.reasoning: SHA-256 is a secure cryptographic hash algorithm used for signing quality certification documents. Not a weak algorithm.

high_findings.title: Certificate/Key Files Referenced
high_findings.description: Scanner detected references to certificate and key files. These are legitimate files for cryptographic signing of certification documents.
high_findings.reasoning: private-key.pem and certification.sig are legitimate files for signing quality certification reports, not for credential theft.

medium_findings.title: External Command Documentation
medium_findings.description: Scanner detected shell command documentation. All commands are in documentation files, describing CLI tools for quality verification.
medium_findings.reasoning: Commands like sonar-scanner, eslint, npx claude-flow are documented for quality verification. No actual command execution occurs in this skill.

content.value_statement: Manual quality checks are inconsistent and time-consuming. This skill automates comprehensive quality verification across static analysis, dynamic testing, and integration validation with measurable certification scores and compliance documentation.
actual_capabilities: Executes 5-phase quality verification workflow with 3 specialized agents
Analyzes code quality metrics including maintainability index and cyclomatic complexity
Runs unit, integration, and E2E tests with coverage tracking
Validates service health and API contract compliance
Calculates weighted certification score with pass/fail gates
Generates compliance documentation and cryptographic signatures
limitations: Requires existing test infrastructure (Jest, Cypress, SonarQube)
Does not fix code issues automatically
Cryptographic signing requires valid private key
External service dependencies must be available for integration tests

use_cases.title: Pre-Release Quality Gate
use_cases.description: Run comprehensive quality verification before production deployment. The skill evaluates static analysis, dynamic testing, and integration validation to calculate a certification score. Build is approved only if score meets threshold.

use_cases.title: CI/CD Pipeline Integration
use_cases.description: Integrate automated quality checks into GitHub Actions or other CI/CD systems. The skill generates certification reports and can fail builds that do not meet quality thresholds.

use_cases.title: Compliance Documentation
use_cases.description: Generate audit trails and compliance documentation for regulatory requirements. The skill produces signed certification reports showing quality metrics and stakeholder sign-off.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Quality Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the when-verifying-quality skill to run a complete quality verification on this project. Start with static analysis, then run all tests, validate integrations, and generate a certification report.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Regression Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a focused quality check using when-verifying-quality. Execute dynamic testing only and verify the test pass rate meets the 95% threshold. Report coverage metrics.

prompt_templates.title: Integration Validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate all service integrations and API contracts using when-verifying-quality. Check database connectivity, message queue operations, and external API availability.

prompt_templates.title: Release Certification
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a release certification report using when-verifying-quality. Calculate the weighted certification score, validate all compliance checks, and create signed documentation.

output_examples.input: Run quality verification on this codebase

best_practices: Run quality verification on every build to catch issues early and maintain consistent standards across releases.
Set realistic thresholds based on project maturity. New projects may need lower initial targets with gradual improvement.
Store certification reports and audit trails for compliance audits and historical quality trend analysis.
Address failing quality gates immediately rather than lowering thresholds to pass.
anti_patterns: Ignoring quality gate failures and proceeding with deployment anyway defeats the purpose of automated verification.
Setting thresholds too high without infrastructure investment leads to constant failures and team frustration.
Running only partial verification phases misses important quality signals from other phases.
Skipping integration validation because services are mocked can hide production issues.

faq.question: What quality gates does this skill enforce?
faq.answer: The skill enforces 8 quality gates: maintainability index (65+), cyclomatic complexity (<10), code duplication (<5%), test pass rate (95%+), test coverage (90%+), branch coverage (85%+), service health (100%), and API contracts (100% verified).

faq.question: Can I customize the quality thresholds?
faq.answer: Yes, thresholds are configurable in the quality-verification.config.js file. You can adjust certification score, maintainability index, test pass rate, and coverage targets based on your project requirements.

faq.question: What testing frameworks are supported?
faq.answer: The skill integrates with Jest (unit tests), Cypress and Playwright (E2E tests), SonarQube and ESLint (static analysis), Pact (contract testing), and TestContainers (database integration).

faq.question: How is the certification score calculated?
faq.answer: The certification score is a weighted average: static analysis (35%), dynamic testing (45%), and integration validation (20%). A score of 80+ with all compliance checks passing is required for approval.

faq.question: Does this skill generate compliance documentation?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill generates comprehensive certification reports including quality metrics, compliance checklists, stakeholder sign-off records, and cryptographic signatures for audit trails.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with my CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: Add the quality verification step to your pipeline configuration. The skill outputs quality-verification-summary.json which your pipeline can read to fail builds that do not meet the certification threshold.
